stream_context.summary: Kaze polishes Course 1 for the upcoming public demo, turning a sky-island section into a Yoshi’s-Island-styled ‘birdhouse’ area, experimenting with tree fades, a new vine/flower elevator mechanic, and fine-tuning physics and slide speed.

development_findings.summary: Re-themed a formerly ‘Minecraft-block’ sky area into a giant birdhouse with Yoshi’s-Island skybox to improve visual coherence.
development_findings.quote: No this is Yoshi's Island, let's make this look like a birdhouse, fuck it, you start in a birdhouse, you end in a birdhouse.

development_findings.summary: Implemented tree-layer fading trick (duplicate geometry, dim/whiten bottom layer) to blend distant canopy into fog after suggestion from Biobak.
development_findings.quote: Leave them the way they were, but make the bottom layer whiter and more transparent, so it looks like they are going down in the fog.

development_findings.summary: Soft-capped slide speed: speeds above 95 gradually decay 5 % per frame instead of the vanilla hard cap at 100, preserving fast entries without breaking normal feel.
development_findings.quote: Usually in vanilla Mario 64 the sliding is hard capped at 100 speed… I soft capped it at 95 so… when you slide on with a lot of speed, you will keep that speed.

development_findings.summary: HD skybox uses only ~36 kB of ROM space (16 textures × 0x900), showing memory budgeting for N64.
development_findings.quote: This is 16 textures and they are all 0x900 each… which is 36 kilobytes, which is not too much.

development_findings.summary: Replacing pipe shortcut with an animated flower-bud elevator: bud wiggles when Mario approaches, player ‘plucks’ it (Bowser grab animation) to grow a rotating vine whose leaves act as an auto-lift, fading into sky.
development_findings.quote: When you try it Mario does the Bowser animation… once you pull it out the flower comes out really fast… you can just jump from leaf to leaf to get up.

development_findings.summary: Decided demo scope: only Course 1, focused on new camera & physics; will launch with Google-form questionnaire to collect player data before full release.
development_findings.quote: I am thinking of releasing a demo with just course 1… together with a questionnaire… so that when I release the full game, we know for sure people like the camera and the physics.

development_findings.summary: Moved modelling workflow from hex-editor hacks to Fast64, keeping HD textures and glove detail while reducing triangles.
development_findings.quote: Nowadays we can use Fast 64 which can do all the stuff that I did hex editor without any of the really really difficult parts.

development_findings.summary: Debug stack: uses NEMU with GDB extension for hard bugs; RS emulator deemed unreliable during stream.
development_findings.quote: If I have to debug my code… I use NEMU… RS fucking sucks, dude.

context_findings.summary: Kaze became a father four weeks ago; balancing newborn care makes scheduling streams and bonus content difficult.
context_findings.quote: If you haven't noticed, I have a small child. That makes planning things really fucking difficult.

context_findings.summary: Mentions mental fatigue—basic math feels harder—attributes it to prolonged stress.
context_findings.quote: Maybe I was just stressed out for so long that my brain functionality is temporarily reduced.

context_findings.summary: Content strategy: weekly videos now possible thanks to hiring an editor; plans to increase upload frequency in December.
context_findings.quote: That's the awesome part about having an editor, I can make so many videos now… I will start increasing my upload frequency around December.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy: wants players to understand mechanics without mandatory dialogue and to support color-blind and deaf accessibility.
context_findings.quote: Ideally this level should be beatable without ever talking to anyone… The game is mostly colorblind friendly. We're looking for colorblind people a little bit. And deaf people too.

biobak.summary: Provided real-time art critiques (tree fade, hill colors, cat-emoji banter) influencing visual tweaks.
biobak.quote: Oh are you sure you don't want this Biobak, I think this looks really good now.

badub.summary: Responsible for music; Kaze praises current track and asks for OST suggestions.
badub.quote: Any OST wishes for today, hell yeah… I love this music too, the music's so good.

key_stories.title: Designing the Sky-Vine Elevator
key_stories.summary: A pipe exit felt dull and visually cluttered, so Kaze brainstormed alternatives live: carrot cannon, vine, then settled on a Yoshi’s-Island flower bud that grows into a rotating vine elevator.
key_stories.challenge: Make travel from the ground stump to sky birdhouse readable, fun, and thematic.
key_stories.process: Chat & Biobak brainstorm; Kaze prototypes leaf spacing, considers player cues, decides on wiggle-when-near, Bowser-grab to pluck, auto-spin ascent, fog fade.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic specced out; model and animation scheduled for off-stream implementation, pipe to be removed.
key_stories.key_quote: I want something really simple, something that just happens… when you get close it gets excited and animates faster, then you pull it out and the flower comes out really fast.

key_stories.title: Soft-Capping Slide Speed
key_stories.summary: Kaze noticed vanilla SM64 kills momentum when entering slides fast; he rewrote the cap to decay gently, preserving advanced movement.
key_stories.challenge: Hard cap at 100 units erased speed-run tricks.
key_stories.process: Changed code so speeds above 95 approach 95 by 5 % each frame instead of instant drop.
key_stories.outcome: Sliding now feels identical in normal use but rewards skilled entries.
key_stories.key_quote: That way it should feel the same when sliding normally, but when you slide on with a lot of speed, you will keep that speed.

key_stories.title: Preparing the Public Demo
key_stories.summary: Kaze outlines an 8-week roadmap for a Course 1 demo paired with a player survey to validate new physics and camera.
key_stories.challenge: Need real-world data before locking core systems.
key_stories.process: Video schedule alignment, Google-doc questionnaire drafting, plan to use community feedback.
key_stories.outcome: Target release 3–8 weeks; questionnaire topics listed live.
key_stories.key_quote: I want more data on gameplay… so that when I release the full game, we know for sure people like the camera and the physics.
